reviewText: Since I owned season 1 DVD set, my expectation of season 2 was lowered accordingly.  Unfortunately, the audio of season 2 is even worse.  I wish the fans are not that forgiving of ADV, because by lowering the bar, you are going to guarantee lower quality in the future.  The only thing we know for certain is that since ADV has the North America distribution rights, we are not going to see a decent release in the forseeable future.  I bought the set to watch the series, but I am not a satisfied customer of ADV.
summary: Worse Than the Season 1 DVD Set
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sailor Moon season 2 is a must buy.  While i admit it does show its age...but you have to keep in mind that these episodes were made back in 1993 so some aging is to be expected.In this sereis you get to see all that DIC left out in their attempt to kiddie sailor moon which was originally created for a teenage audience.  I was very surprised when i discovered that DIC actually did not leave out any episodes in this season like they did in the previous....so you get the season as you saw it on Toonami, but uncut, and unkiddied.  I was only disapointed to find that none of the seasons are bi-lingual so you cant make-fun of DIC anymore for its butchering of sailor moon. Luckily i dont mind subtitles and i LOVE the japanese voices which are very cute, especially Ami-chan's.As in the season one set you will find no special features, but as there are 42 episodes to watch, you will be more than satisfied with that.And for those who wish to know, runnig time is 450 minutes in Japanese 2.0 with english subtitles (as i mention above this is NOT bi-lingual) and the suggested rating is 15+ for some violence and nudity i believe and some language.This is a season all fans will be sure to enjoy....dont miss out....they are only goind to make so many copies so hurry and get yours today before you miss out and are stuck with the DIC dubbed versions on VHS.
summary: A MUST HAVE FOR DIE HARD FANS!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sailor Moon R (Season Two) was the very first anime I ever saw, and I fell in love at first sight. The characters, the action, the moves--I adored it all. And my favorite part of Sailor Moon is the villains, with the R villains reigning supreme. Ail/Allan and Ann of the Doom Tree...The Ayakashi Sisters/Black Moon Sisters...Emeraude/Emerald...Diamond...Sapphire...ten years later they still rank in my top fifty favorite characters.I've been looking for this DVD set for years, and I have finally been able to afford it! I plan to watch it all and reminisce as soon as it arrives in the mail. Yay for memories!I recommend this to all Sailor Moon fans. Not only is this the introduction of Rini/Chibiusa, but it is one of the best sections of a world-renowned series!
summary: If only I could give it more than 5 stars....

reviewText: Finally, ADV Films has taken the time to subtitle the second (And Best season in my opinion) season of Pretty Soldier Sailor Moon. Yes, I will add, it does NOT contain Episode 67, but that was a filler, with no plot, no action, and definitly NO mention of the Black Moon family at all. So please, stop this complaint! There's nothing wrong with the set without this episode. In my opinion, I think it's better without this episode. For people that haven't seen it, your NOT missing out on anything! It's a really lame episode about when Rei goes to an island to relax, and the rest of the Sailor Senshi join her. Chibi-Usa tastes Makoto's fish, and realizes, she doesn't like it. She finds a dinosaur, and they become friends. Pretty lame...  On either September 16th, or 23rd, I'll buy this set, and post my review not long after i watch all 41 episodes. The audio quality should be slightly better, as well as the video. For the first season, like I said, you just need to adjust your T.V., and the Video Quality to "Personal-Animation" Quality, of you have a Philips TV.UPDATES: Dec. 24th 2003Packaging: A+Content: ASubtitling: BVideo: BAudio: BDurability: B+Inserts: A-Disc Quality: A+Extra's: D+Translations: B-Finally I was able to write a review! I've been busy with schoolwork, and I just got out of a messy love-traingle. Let's start out with the good stuff. I LOVE the packaging! A huge improvment from the Season One boxset. The two seperate cases have a BEAUTIFUL image of Neo-Queen Serenity and the other has a picture of Sailor Moon using Moon Princess Halation. I really like the whole SailormoonR season. The Audio and Video quality is again an inprovment! The audio is clear, as the video is wonderful. The colors are so rich. And now for the bad stuff... First off, I have to say the translations. Why on earth did they use dub terms like "Moon Scepter" and "Moon Princess Elimanation". The spelling like Koan instaed of Cooan is tollerable, yes, but it does get confusing when I don't know who Betirucher is. It can be confusing at times. They refrian from the actual expressions used. It doesn't bother me, but it's weird when someone says "darn you" when you know what they're saying, whether you speak Japanese or not. Well, the extra's are nothing to brag about... because there is none except for ADV trailers.Overall, his set is HIGHLY reccomended! The subtitling track could use some work, but other than that its wonderful!MPAA: TV-14 on International ChannelMy Rating: 14+ADV Rating: 15+ for: Violent Images, Brief Nudity, and Strong thematic elements including mild sexuallity and language(Update: The new Geneon Sailor Moon products say there is sexuallity in Sailor Moon. On the Sailor Moon S Movie, it says "Rated 13 for Mild Violence and Sexuality, Scary Moments" What about the nudity and language... huh?)

reviewText: Alright, the moment we've been waiting for since the first uncut season got on DVD, yay! The Second season! I cant wait! When I saw a box that said Amazon.com written on it, I went straight to my room, and watched the whole first season till my eyes were bleeding, and it paid off, it was awesome. I mean I cried laughed, etc... SO now I hope that this season will make me cry and laugh again because I really want this second season to be really good! I mean you get to watch Usagi and the rest grow up, and I hey, I wanna know exactly what happened in the uncut version cause ya know its gonna be dramatic and hilarious! So buy it, enjoy it, cause hey, we've been waiting a pretty long time for this! Now, I hope I can see the 5th season of Sailor Moon. HOPE!

reviewText: Because the latest I've heard from ADV, North America is soon to lose all it's Sailor Moon air and DVD rights, due to pricing conflicts with Toehi,so it looks like we won't be seeing S, SS or Sailor Stars as Boxed sets anytime soon, if ever. Hopefully, one day some other company will settle these issues.Yes this could have been done better, but at least it is better than nothing at all.My only beef with this set is the way the tags for each episode was run AFTER the credits, instead of before, as in the original version.But I'm nitpicking.So are others, when they complain about the "crappy" sound. Many people are not aware that only "Sailor Stars" was recorded in stereo. The previous seasons were recorded in good ol'mono.I also was lucky enough to snag a later set that had Ep. 67 on it.All and all, not bad for the $52 I paid for it here at auction.
summary: I'm just glad to have this...

reviewText: We should be so lucky if ADV released all 5 seasons of Sailormoon withe such rigor and high quality as this set.  And for the record, ADV did not "cut" episode 67-- they couldn't get the rights to it... and not even they're sure why the Japanese owner won't sell it to them!  You may have to adjust your TV's audio a little... most people who complain about the audio have outdated TVs, else don't know how to use them.This season is really one of my favorites because of the great character development given to all the Scouts.  Ok, Ok, so I do want to get a gun out whenever that "little pink thing" comes out on the screen, but the rest is worth it.  Please enjoy Sailor Moon as much of the rest of us do, and also please don't go to conventions cross-playing as Sailor Mercury, ok?

reviewText: Enjoyed already the the uncut original first season? You don't have to wait for so long, here comes the second season (Sailor Moon R). Till the fifth and last season released sometime in future, we can now enjoy the four original seasons of Sailor Moon released by Pioneer and ADV.Sailor Moon Season Two (Uncut) contains 42 full episodes and over 1000+ minutes. Like the uncut season one, it consists of 8 DVDs packed in 2 boxes sold together. There is also no dubbing, only Japanese voice with English subtitle...

reviewText: Just when Usagi/Serena and everyone had normal lives again. Luna must bring them back into the sailor scout world. A new enemy has come to their attention. The enemy needs to power the doom tree with human energy so that they can survive. The Sailor Scouts need to find out who this new enemy is and destroy the doom tree before everyone in the world is taken by the tree. All the while darien/mamoru brakes up with Usagi because he has a dream that says she will die if he falls in love with her. Also, A mysterious girl shows up. It turns out shes from the future and she needs to save her mom. This Box Set is again like the first season only dubbed in the original japanese language with english text. A must have for all Sailor Moon fans.

reviewText: Season 2 will start after Sailor Moon and the Scouts just finished off Queen Baryle.  But then, 2 aliens landed on Earth and want to steal energy from everyone on earth to feed their doom tree and desguise themselves as brother and sister.  Then they learned that the doom tree really needed to be loved with positive evergy and not the negative energy.  Then, this totally cute pink hair girl falls from the sky and the Nega Moon follows the pink hair girl who really comes from the 30th centry, looking for help from Sailor Moon and the Salior Scouts to revive her mother (Who later on in the story finds out that her mom and dad are really Sailor Moon and Tuxedo Mask) Can Sailor Moon and the Sailor Scouts save the future of earth while saving their own future?  All of your answers are here in "Sailor Moon Season 2)

reviewText: Finally! Sailor Moon the way it's SUPPOSED to be. Fans now don't have to sit through bad dubbing, fuzzy bootlegs, and don't have to hear those 3 horrible words: "Serena", "Darien", and "Rini".For those of you who are first timers in this TV series, you'll find that this is a great investment. Not only are you getting the 2nd season uncut and uncensored, but you're getting a series that millions of fans around the world have grown to love. Any age can enjoy Sailor Moon and it offers comedy, drama, suspense, action, romance.... oh the list goes on.And for those of you who have only seen the English version... I am so sorry. Please do yourself a favor and get yourself this DVD box set and watch the show in its Original format. THIS is the real Sailor Moon....And don't be intimidated by subtitles. They are actually 10 times better.

reviewText: The Sailormoon TV series showed us how dubbing could be done badly, but this uncut set gives us all the original dialogue AND scenes that were cut out before being brought to America, i.e. the scene where Chibi Usa holds a gun to Usagi's head. Take my word for it, if you're going to watch anime, insist on the original. Watching in subtitles also helps you to pick up a bit on the Japanese language, and learning is always good.

reviewText: ...but the episode that's missing not only has no relevance to the main plot, but really isn't very good - in fact, in my opinion it's the single worst episode in the entire series.It involves Chibi-Usa making friends with a prehistoric sea creature, and deciding she likes to eat fish. Need I say more?I'm as disappointed as everyone else that this won't be a complete set. However, if you pass on this set because episode 67 is missing, you're doing yourself a great disservice. It's an excellent series that deserves a place on your shelf even with this one (bad) episode missing.

reviewText: Even back when I only had the English dub of this on TV & a tape, this was my favorite season.  For the record the dub for this season was better as well, since they only skipped one episode which happened to be one of the worst ones from this season.  But nothing compares to the original.The season begins with the Makaiju arc, about 2 aliens who are the last of their kind coming to Earth and stealing energy to keep their tree alive.  Despite being filler created just so Naoko could write more of the manga, I thought it was quite good apart from a couple silly episodes.  But it's overshadowed by the primary story this season, the Black Moon arc.  The Black Moon Clan is a group of villains from the future who want to alter the past so that they can conquer the future more easily.  We first meet Rubeus & the 4 Ayakashi sisters, who are like psycho versions of the Sailor Soldiers (except for Moon).  That's not the only problem our heroes have.  They also have to deal with a pink-haired girl who also appears to be from the future & wants the Silver Crystal for unknown purposes.  And after Mamoru has a series of dreams that warn him that something bad will happen to Usagi if they stay together, he breaks up with her, though he still continues to save her as Tuxedo Mask.  Things were already more interesting than before, but things get even better when the sisters start turning good.  It was so fascinating seeing these villains reform, & had me interested in what Rubeus' punishment would be.  It must have been horrible, because he risks it all in a last ditch attempt to destroy our heroes, and fails of course.  We then get the high-ups in the Black Moon Clan as we meet Demande, his brother Saphir, his would-be lover Esmerelde & his inhuman councilor Wiseman.  This part of the season is just the best, so I won't spoil anymore of it.  I honestly think this whole season blended together well.  This is my favorite because of how well it focuses on the relationship between Usagi & Mamoru.  It does what every second season of a show should do, expand upon something from the first.  Sadly, poor Mamoru'll be downplayed less & less each season from now on.  A pity as he is by far my favorite character, but the next season and a half is still great.This time, the anime is definitely better than the manga.  The main reason being the villains.  They are all so much better in the anime.  The Ayakashi Sisters were fleshed out characters as opposed to being simply monsters of the week, Rubeus died a dignified death as opposed to his manga counterpart, & let me just say Saphir I much more sympathetic here than in the manga.  I'm not always for making villains less evil in adaptions (I hate Stars because of how they handled Sailor Galaxia compared to the manga) but in this case I'll make an exception as it was so well-done.  The only blunder this season did was in not giving Tuxedo Kamen his attack like in the manga, but that's all.  I can always pretend he got it sometime after the third season (I'll explain why in my SuperS review).If you have the first season already this is a must-buy.  Good luck finding it as it has taken me a very long time to get to where I am now in my SM collection (all I'm missing is one SuperS DVD & the movie for that season & then I'll own all I want to of Sailor Moon).  Tune in next time when the improvement over the manga as well as the quality of the dubbing reaches an all-time high in Sailor Moon S.

reviewText: I love Bishoujo Senshi Sera Muun, AKA Sailor Moon.  I looked at this set shown here, and I saw that episode number 67 was missing.  I also noticed that the pictures were different from the one ADV has on its website.  I don't know if it really is just a typo, or if there really is no episode 67 in this version.  this cover is more politically correct though, because in ADV's they have Sailor ChibiMoon where Dark Lady is on this one.  And Chibimoon didn't appear until "S".  In "R" we see three forms of Chibi-Usa, Chibi-Usa/Small Lady, Dark lady, and the Moon Princess.  If you love Uncut Box Sets like I do, You can order the "S" uncut box set from ... it is an import and has all 38 episodes from the "S" season, where Pioneer only put out 37 episodes even in their uncut format on DVD, without the box.  If you want, email me at ... becayse I have asked ADV about the covers and the "missing" episode.  This is a GREAT season and will be even better even if they don't have the episode 67.
